Class ReversiGame

java.lang.Object
com.reversi.common.ReversiGame
public class ReversiGame extends Object
ReversiGame encapsulates the core logic of a Reversi game including board state management, move validation, disc flipping, and player turn management. It is responsible for executing game moves and serializing/deserializing game state to/from JSON.

The class leverages Jackson annotations to enable JSON serialization and deserialization using custom serializer and deserializer classes.

  • Constructor Details

    • ReversiGame

      public ReversiGame()
      Default constructor that initializes the game with the standard starting board and sets the initial player to Black.

    • ReversiGame

      public ReversiGame(Board board, Player currentPlayer)
      Constructs a game instance with a specific board state and current player.
      Parameters:
      board - the initial board configuration
      currentPlayer - the player whose turn is first in this configuration

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Retrieves the current state of the game board.
      Returns:
      the Board representing the current board state

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Retrieves the current player whose turn is to make a move.
      Returns:
      the Player currently active

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove(int row, int col)
      Determines whether placing a disc at the specified row and column is a valid move for the current player.
      Parameters:
      row - the 0-indexed row position on the board
      col - the 0-indexed column position on the board
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid; false otherwise

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove(int row, int col)
      Attempts to execute a move for the current player at the specified position.

      If the move is valid, the board state is updated (including flipping any opponent discs) and the turn is switched to the opposing player.

      Parameters:
      row - the 0-indexed row position where the disc is placed
      col - the 0-indexed column position where the disc is placed
      Returns:
      true if the move was successfully executed; false if invalid

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares the provided object with this game instance for equality. Two game instances are considered equal if they have the same board state and the same current player.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to be compared for equality with this game
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this game; false otherwise

    • loadFrom

      public void loadFrom(ReversiGame o)
      Loads the state of this game from another game instance.
      Parameters:
      o - the other ReversiGame whose state is to be copied
